note.p: Birth: Sodra, Rashult, Smaland, Sweden (23 or 24 May 1707)
Research Field: Botany, zoology, geology, taxonomy, medicine
Career: Physician to the king of Sweden (by 1753); Professor of Physic and Botany, University of Uppsala (by 1753)

Visited the Royal Society in August 1736 at the invitation of Cromwel Mortimer, RS Secretary, to view the herbarium of Sir Hans Sloane then in The Repository in the Society's headquarters on Crane Court, London.
References: William T Stearn, 'The Wilkins Lecture, 1985. John Wilkins, John Ray and Carl Linnaeus' in NR 1985-86 vol 40 pp 101-123
Roy A Rauschenberg, 'John Ellis, FRS: Eighteenth Century Naturalist and Royal Agent to West Florida' in NR 1977-8 vol 32 pp 149-164
John Thomas, 'Josiah Wedgwood's Portrait Medallions of Fellows of the Royal Society' in NR 1963 vol 18 pp 45-53, plate
C Broad, 'The Linnaeus Link Project' in NR 2005 vol 59 pp 201-203
E. Charles Nelson, 'Linnaeus in England, Summer 1736' in The Linnean, April 2021, Vol 37(1) pp 31-34
Notes: DSB gives birth date as 23 May 1707
